feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Looking for Payload Structure for AI Adapter's with Request Payload Source as Exchange Body
entry.content:
Unable to successfully pass the configuration payload to the AI Core Orchestration service, resulting in a persistent HTTP 400 Bad Request. 

Passing the Payload via Content Modifier in the previous step before the AI Adapter Call 

Endpoint Used: https://xxxx.hana.ondemand.com/v2/inference/deployments/<deployment_id>/completion 

require confirmation of the exact, mandatory JSON payload structure (including all required keys, nesting, and data types) for Orchestration- completion.

Message Protocol :AICore-GenAIHub

Operation: Orchestration  - completion

Request Payload Source : Exchange Body

Expecting a Payload Structure something like this or steps to achieve this?

{
"orchestration_config": {
"module_configurations": {
"llm_module_config": {
"model_name": "gemini-2.5-flash"
},
"templating_module_config": {
"template": "incident-categorization" (Create it in Prompt Editor)
}
}
},
"input_params": {
"taxComplianceCheck": false,
"fraudRiskScore": 0.7
}
}

entry.title: How to Use Parameters and Imported Archives in SAP CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on a message mapping in SAP CPI and I'm not sure how to use the Parameter tab in the mapping editor. I understand it's meant for passing external values into the mapping, but I’m unclear on how it behaves at runtime or how to bind it properly from the iFlow.

Also, I’d love to understand how Imported Archives work in this context. Can we use custom Java functions from these archives inside user-defined functions (UDFs)? If so, what are the best practices for organizing and referencing them?

Any examples or insights from your experience would be really helpful. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Difficulty Triggering Workflow in SuccessFactors When Data Is Auto-Posted from BTP
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m working on an integration where contract end data is auto-posted from SAP BTP to SuccessFactors (SF) . The data is being posted into the Resignation portlet, and I want to trigger a workflow in SF when this happens. But, the workflow is not getting triggered when the data is posted from BTP. 

Thanks,
Sakshi

entry.title: Multiple Timer - Schedule in one IFlow
entry.content:
Hi, Is it possible to add multiple schedule for a timer to run twice a day with a specific time in one IFlow?

Example:
I wanted to schedule this IFlow to run twice a day every 4:45AM and 2PM. 

This current IFlow is still using Timer version 1.0


or by using the new Timer version 1.4 - can this be achievable?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: IDOCs failing in SAP system : IDoc: XXX Status: Error passing data to port | Problem with SOAP class
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have numerous IDOC-based scenarios between SAP and SAP Integration Suite.

We have recently noticed that a few IDocs fail in the SAP system with the message:

Status Text: IDoc: <Idoc number> Status: Error passing data to port

T100 Text: Problem with SOAP class

 

In SRT_LOG, there are entries as follows: 

  • The SOAP IDoc application could not be started successfully.
  • The problem occurred in the method call: execute_processing
  • 1007:SRT: Unsupported xstream found: ("HTTP Code 404 : Not Found")

SRT_LOG (Original XML Error)

There are other successful IDocs being sent at the same time to the SAP IS interface. This seems to me like a temporary connectivity issue between SAP and SAP IS, but I need your expert advice on how it can be identified and fixed to avoid such issues.

Regards,

Prajeet

entry.title: Releases and Updates for SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hello Experts

Currently I am learning SAP Integration Suite. I am wondering where I can get the details on releases / patches / updates that relate to SAP Integration Suite.

For applications like SAP SuccessFactors, I go to the Product Roadmap site, to know about the half yearly releases.

Similarly for SAP Integration Suite, do we have a website dedicated to releases / patches / updates?

Thanks in advance.

Arul

entry.title: CPI: OData v2 PATCH request includes key in body
entry.content:
I'm creating an iflow using the OData v2 adapter to connect to S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 (on-premise) using the SalesOrder (A2X) API package. The iflow needs to update a Sales Order with a delivery block.

For this I'm using a PATCH request. This request is automatically configured through the wizard fetching the metadata from the S/4HANA server:

The payload data is set via a message mapping taking the values from exchange properties, being mapped to the XSD generated from the above PATCH configuration:

Given that 'SalesOrder' is the key field it is marked as mandatory in the EDMX and a value is required.

The problem I'm facing is that the query going to S/4HANA correctly has the key field in the url, but also (incorrectly) in the body:

request:
PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder(SalesOrder='123')

body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A_SalesOrder>
  <A_SalesOrderType>
    <SalesOrder>123</SalesOrder>
    <DeliveryBlockReason>50</DeliveryBlockReason>
  </A_SalesOrderType>
</A_SalesOrder>

To which S/4HANA responds: "Key field SALESORDER must not be changed.". This error is correct according to the OData specification mentioning that key fields should not be part of the body. This is also confirmed by the API docs: "You must always provide all key fields in the URL to identify the entity." A simple test case without that field in the body goes through fine.

I know that I can easily get around this by using custom logic etc, but I'm looking for a clean, out-of-the-box solution.

Is there a specific configuration in the OData v2 adapter to make it remove key fields from the body for patch calls? Removing the field from the 'Fields' setting does not make a difference.

entry.title: Can we suspend interfaces by EventMesh?
entry.content:
Dear SAP specialists,

Currently we are implementing S/4HANA cloud Public Edition and BTP Integration Suite.
Most outbound interfaces are triggerred by EventMesh technology. 

To consider daily operation, our client wants to have offline time (to profibit input operation).
It comes from the point to keep consistency of the data among several interfaces.

Can we suspend interfaces during several hours?
After resuming, the data which is created during the time should be interfaced.

Thanks and best regards,

Masatomo Makino

entry.title: Send default HTTP200 from SAP APIM
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a requirement where the API consumer is expecting a HTTP 200 response, irrespective of the backend response (error or success). We have exposed CPI iFlows through API proxies and the client is a Saas application connecting to APIM endpoints.

Please confirm if anyone has been able to achieve this functionality using SAP APIM policies, as we would like to avoid adding logic for this in iFlows.

 

Regards,

Diptee

entry.title: S/4HANA to Bank SFTP via CPI – AL11 vs Client SFTP
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are integrating S/4HANA Private Cloud with a Bank SFTP through SAP CPI (PGP encryption handled in CPI). An ABAP program in S/4HANA will generate and place the output file either on AL11 or a client SFTP location. Considering two options:
1️. S/4 → AL11 → CPI → Bank SFTP (BASIS mounts SFTP on AL11)
2. S/4 → Client SFTP → CPI → Bank SFTP

Which approach is SAP-recommended / best practice? Does SAP provides any free SFTP server for such use? If we mount external client SFTP to AL11, does it makes any sense as eventually we will be picking the file from SFTP server.

Thanks,

Mohit

entry.title: Performance Difference Observed Between IIB and SAP IS – Database Query Response Time
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am an IBM Integration Bus (IIB) resource currently working on a migration project where I’m assisting the SAP Integration team by providing the IIB landscape and architecture required for migration to SAP Integration Suite (SAP IS).

As part of a small performance comparison and feasibility test, I simulated a very basic database interaction scenario in SAP IS and observed a significant difference in response time compared to IIB.  I would appreciate guidance on whether this is expected behavior or caused by trial environmental limits.
[Note]:I also tried interacting with IBM MQ SAAS and compared SAP IS and IBM IIB results, again, ending with similar situation(not covered in this Post).

Test setup and observations:

  • I created a SAP HANA Cloud (trial) database for testing.
  • Added a single test table containing only 3 rows of static data.
  • Built a simple SAP iFlow with:
    • An HTTP Sender Adapter to invoke the flow.
    • Three simple SELECT statements(3 calls) to the HANA DB (no transforms, no mappings).
    • No other processing steps.
  • When I invoke the iFlow via HTTP, the total response time is around 7–10 seconds consistently.
  • For comparison, I implemented the same logic in IIB (connected to an SQL Server) and observed typical response times of 100–200 ms. (Occasionally the first call after a long idle takes ~500–700 ms.)

Additional context:

  • The SAP IS trial account is hosted in the US East (VA)-AWS region, whereas the SAP HANA Cloud trial database is in the Singapore Azure region.
  • In the IIB scenario, both IIB runtime and the SQL Server database are co-located in the same data center, likely explaining the ultra-low latency observed there.
  • The http request is initiated(for both tests) using postman from Cloud PC somewhere in US.
  • I understand that cross-region latency can contribute to higher response times, but a difference of 7–10 seconds vs 100–200 miliseconds still feels unusually high for such a lightweight query.

Primary question:

Is the observed delay in SAP IS due to the HANA Cloud trial environment (resource throttling, cold starts, or connection setup time on every request sent), or is there inherent overhead in SAP IS runtime for such DB interactions?

Specific areas where guidance would help:

  • Does SAP IS / DB adapter use connection pooling or persistent connections to the database?
  • Are there known limitations in trial HANA or IS tenants that can cause high round-trip time?
  • Are there runtime or adapter-level settings to minimize latency for repeated database operations?
  • Would response time improve noticeably in a production-grade tenant (same region) setup?

I would greatly appreciate any insights, documentation references, or configuration tips to help understand and potentially improve this response time behavior.

-Dhruv

entry.title: Unable to Access “Design, Develop, and Manage APIs” After Completing Integration Suite Booster
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m currently going through the SAP Integration Suite onboarding tutorials. I successfully completed all the steps in the “Enable the SAP Integration Suite” booster, and the process completed with a success message.

However, when I moved to the next tutorial: “Create an API Provider System”, I got stuck at Step 2, which asks to open the API Management Portal via “Design, Develop, and Manage APIs”.

Here’s what I have already tried:

  • Verified Integration Suite is subscribed in my BTP subaccount

  • Tried re-opening via the “Go to Application” button

  • Cleared cache and tried Incognito mode

  • Waited for some time in case it was a delay

  • Checked tutorials again, but couldn't find what might be missing

I also tried searching the community and SAP Help, but couldn’t find a clear solution for this specific issue.

Has anyone faced a similar problem or can guide me on how to enable API Management properly so I can proceed with creating an API Provider?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Issue Migrating Integrations to SAP Integration Suite via "Migrate Process Orchestration Artifacts"
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m currently facing an issue while trying to migrate integrations from SAP Process Orchestration (PO) to SAP Integration Suite using the Migrate Process Orchestration Artifacts tool.

I have successfully configured the connection to the Process Orchestration System, and the connection test is successful. In Step 2 of the migration wizard, I can see and select the integration scenarios available in PO without any issues.

However, in the Pattern step, where I should be able to select an integration pattern, no options are displayed, as shown in the image below:

Has anyone in the community faced a similar issue? Are there any additional prerequisites or configurations required to have the integration patterns show up correctly in this step?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: flow control between exception sub process and main flow: SAP CPI-IS
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have an iflow Where I have used the main flow to call a local process and defined the exception sub process to capture the exceptions within that local process. The exception sub process is configured to end with a end message step and before that step a content modifier is used to mark the message as failed explicitly, using the property - SAP_MarkMessageAsFailed = true.

However, I am seeing that when an exception occurs in the main flow, it  calls the local process and it goes to the exception sub process defined in that local process.
The  exception sub process works as expected - format a custom csv message, sends to an external http receiver using request reply and calls the end step. But, even after ending the message (and along with SAP_MarkMessageAsFailed = true.) it still passes the control back to main flow. And surprisingly, it does not execute the flow step immediately after the step where it failed in the main flow/process. It skips so many steps and all of a sudden picks a router step to execute. 
Is there a easy way to stop the message processing when it comes back from local process/ sub exception process?
And I am not sure why it is executing a router step which is far away from the actual failed step.

Thanks
Sugata
Please see the images attached.

entry.title: Creating an Account on the SAP Gateway Demo System has been disabled
entry.content:

I'm currently learning the SAP Integration Suite and working through this topic: Exploring the Capabilities of SAP Integration Suite

However, when I try to follow it, I get the message: "Creating an Account on the SAP Gateway Demo System has been disabled."

Since the following tasks in the module seem to depend on having access to that system, I’m wondering: What’s the recommended workaround or alternative to complete this part of the learning journey?

Thanks in advance for any guidance!

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite - Content Modifier Change Authorisation Header OData Adapter
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Can anyone help? The security material is not working. But I can get the bearer token with a HTTP adapter. But I cannot use the security material to get the bearer token, there is an issue with the validation of the audience. And I can't get the JWT token to see what it says. But if I can put the bearer token into the OData adapter, it will work. I can replace the authorisation header in a HTTP adapter but it will not work in the OData adapter for some reason. 

I try to put the bearer token in but the authorization header is not created. 

Any help would be really appreciated. I am stuck. 

 

Best regards, 

    Seamus
